acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: From a description of LD50 value of >5,000mg/kg (HSDB (2005)) in the dermal administration test employing rabbits, it was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was classified into Category 4 from LD50 value 1,950 mg/kg (JECFA (1980), HSDB (2005)) of the oral administration test employing a rat. In addition, in EU classification, it is Xn; R22 (EU-Annex I).

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it is classified into group 2B (IARC 10 (Suppl.7 1987)) according to IARC and was classified into Category R (NTP RoC (11th 2005)) according to NTP, it classified into Category 2. In addition, the European Union classification is Cat.2; R45 (EU-Annex I).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Since the flash point by HSDB(2005) is 100degC(closed type), it was classified into Not classified.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there were descriptions of "positive" (HSDB (2005)) in the body cell in vivo genotoxicity test (SCE test employing rat hepatocytes, DNA adduct formation test employing rat hepatocytes) and "positive" (mouse lymphoma test) (NTP DB (Access on October 2008)) in the in vitro mutagenicity test, and "negative" (chromosome aberration test employing a CHO cell) (NTP DB (Access on October 2008)), it was classified into Category 2 by experts' judgment. In addition, EU classification is Muta. Cat. 3; R68 (EU-Annex I).

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Although it is an organic compound including oxygen, not fluorine and chlorine, this oxygen has not chemically bound to any elements other than carbon and hydrogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since there is no datum for the reproductive developmental toxicity study, classification is not possible.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method suitable for liquid substances is not established.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Although the unsaturated bond is included in chemical structure, classification is not possible with no data.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There are descriptions, "moderately irritating" (HSDB (2005)) in the 24.hour study with rabbits and "not irritating" (HSDB (2005)) in the skin irritation test with mouse. Since the primary literature of these data is not available and details are unknown, classification is not possible. Moreover, there is a description, "Moderate" (RTECS (2007)) in the 24 hour Draize test with rabbits, although it is from an information source of List 3.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although there is a "negative" (HSDB (2005)) description in the Maximization test of humans (25 volunteers), classification is not possible because of insufficient data since it is the source of information from List2.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, skeletal muscle)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since "damage in liver" (JECFA (1980)) was observed in the oral administration test in male and female rats, and "skeletal muscle atrophy", "severe liver fat infiltration" and "atrophy and necrosis of hepatocytes " (JECFA (1980), HSDB) were observed in the oral administration test in male and female dogs within the limits of the guidance value of Category 2, it is classified into Category 2 (liver, skeletal muscles).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since "nausea, shock, cyanosis, hallucinations, circulatory collapse, spasm, a miosis, dizziness, sensory paralysis, aphasia, and respiratory depression" were described as a human acute symptom by HSDB (2005), it was classified into Category 2 (central nervous systems). Moreover, the examinations employing the rabbit which was data of the information source of List3 also has a description of "spastic paralysis and motor ataxia" within the limits of the guidance value of Category 2 (RTECS (2007).) .
